page.title: 13Amenities in Upper Strensham
page.content: Strensham has a population of 161. In Upper Strensham most people work outside the village. Agriculture and the service station give employment to some inhabitants, unemployment is almost non-existant. Seven people from the vilage work on three farms. The service station employs 8 people, mostly women. There is a Parish council, an Almshouse trust, a Womens Institute, a Parochial Church Council and a village hall committee. A fete is held annually. There is a telephone kiosk, a post box and a childrens play area. The shop has closed but a baker, milkman and the library call regularly. Two vans one selling hardware, the other grocery, call weekly. People use the service station particularly for petrol and newspapers.
